item.title: Why I think you should use only LTS versions of .NET
item.description: In this blog post, I want to share with you why I think you should use only LTS versions of .NET when programming. If you’re not familiar with the terms, LTS stands for Long Term Support and .NET is the platform that provides a runtime, a SDK, and various libraries and frameworks for building applications. .NET has a release cadence of one major version every year in November. Each release is either LTS or STS (Standard Term Support).
